CatDescriptText: Mr. Richard Wolf, electronics technician, Coraopolis, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 12, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "What do you think about Negro political leadership at local and national levels? Does it carry 'weight' among Negroes or white people or both?  Why?" answer reads: "Definitely among Negroes, and I think the same effect among whites, especially those not so bigoted.  Any person who is broadminded [sic] does not care about the race of a leader.  If a leader has a job and does it right, then they will follow him."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Richard Wolf wearing light colored button down collared shirt and wood grained necktie with clip, standing in front of store with awning
